answers.author: Ann Mahoney
answers.text:
Larry--ICMA publishes The Ethics Edge (Jonathan West and Evan Berman are the editors), which includes six short cases in Appendix A. Two might be relevant for your needs--one about union negotiations and one about "the errant elected official." Also, a chapter by Craig Wheeland is called "Partisan Politics, Ethics, and the Home Rule Charter"--and is written as a case study. You can see a description of the book and the book's table of contents at http://bookstore.icma.org/The_Ethics_Edge_-_2nd_Edition_P401C6.cfm
Let me know if I can be of any other help.

author: Larry Paine
text:
I will be doing a presentation a week from now to a small group of elected officials.  I am looking for some case studies involving governing bodies that I can use in the presentation.  
What I am looking for is:
•   A short background of the situation
•   A description of the ethics issue
•   How/if the situation was solved
•   Any lessons learned or changed behavior by the governing body as a result of the issue
Send to lpaine@cityofhillsboro.net
Thanks for the help.
Larry Paine
City Administrator
Hillsboro, KS
title: Elected Official Ethics Issue
